meanings.sent1: She accidentally misbound the pages of her book together.
meanings.sent2: The tailor often misbinds the edges of the fabric, causing issues later on.
meanings.sent3: The misbinding of the shoelaces made the shoes look like a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to fix the clock ended up misbinding the gears, leading to a strange ticking sound.
meanings.sent5: The misbinding of the documents resulted in a mix-up that took hours to untangle.

meanings.definition: The act of binding something incorrectly or improperly.
meanings.sent1: The misbinding of the contract led to legal complications.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the misbinding of the book when pages started falling out.
meanings.sent3: The misbinding of the ribbons made the gift look oddly charming.
meanings.sent4: The misbinding of the wires caused a short circuit in the system.
meanings.sent5: The misbinding of the quilt gave it a unique, handmade feel.
